intro: Cyclotrichium floridum, commonly known as the Florida crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces showy yellow flowers with white ray florets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and prairies. Cyclotrichium floridum is an important component of native plant communities and supports local pollinators.
